copywrite-description: Sugarizer School Portal is a free software under Apache 2 licence and its source code is available on GitHub.
sugarizer-school-portal-subtitle: Host your own Sugarizer Server deployment in a few clicks...
sugarizer-school-portal-description: Sugarizer School Portal is a new tool in the Sugarizer family which provides a way for schools interested by Sugarizer to host and manage themselves their Sugarizer deployment. It provides an on-demand (SaaS) Sugarizer Server deployment tool so that every school will be able to create a Sugarizer Server to host its own deployment without any technical skill in just a few clicks.
one-click-deployment-description: Sugarizer School Portal provides on-demand (SaaS) Sugarizer Server deployment so that every school can create a Sugarizer Server to host its own deployment without any technical skill in just a few clicks.
database-backup-description: Sugarizer School Portal uses MGOB to provide automatic database backup facility. In case of database failure, your data can be restored almost instantly by running a few commands on the cluster. It also provides an optional facility to backup the data on the cloud bucket.
secure-description: Sugarizer School Portal and the Sugarizer Server deployments can be run on HTTPS. The sensitive information is securely hashed. It also provides an optional email validation feature for the Client signup.
slack-notifications-description: Sugarizer School Portal supports Slack Webhooks. It can be integrated with your slack workspace to send notifications to your favourite channel whenever a new deployment is created or destroyed.
easy-configuration-description: All the features of the Sugarizer School Portal can be easily configured by modifying the configuration file. It also provides a setup script for automatic cluster configuration and installation.
runs-on-kube-description: Sugarizer School Portal can be easily configured to run on Azure Kubernetes Service, Google Kubernetes Engine, Microk8s and more. It also supports cross platform integration where it can use Cloud DNS service of one provider and Kubernetes service of another.
manage-deployments-description: Sugarizer School Portal can be used to manage the Sugarizer Server deployments running on the Kubernetes cluster. A Sugarizer Server deployment can be launched or destroyed on the press of a simple button. It can also be used to add admin users to the deployments.
health-checks-description: Sugarizer School Portal runs regular health checks on the deployments every few seconds to check if the deployments are listening to the incoming requests. In case of some issue, an error status is displayed on the Health view on the dashboard.
client-greeting-description: It looks like your first time on Sugarizer School Portal Dashboard. Click on the Request Deployment button to request for a new Sugarizer Server deployment.
request-deployment-instructions: Fill the deployment request form and click on the Save button to request a new deployment.
